caption:
This aerial photograph showcases a landscape heavily characterized by a combination of forested areas and rural development. Much of the visible landscape is occupied by a dense forest comprised predominantly of tall, slender trees. There appears to be substantial variation in the health and density of the trees, suggesting potential environmental impacts or forest management activities. Several areas within the forest show signs of clearing and thinned vegetation, possibly indicating logged sections or paths for access through the woods.

A distinct feature of the image is a winding dirt road that cuts across the photograph, surrounded by patches of cleared land. This road appears to be a primary way of accessing different areas within the forest.

Toward the left side of the image, there's a rural residential area or a small community. The residences, with their light-colored roofs, are distinctly visible against the green backdrop of the surrounding lawns and patches of trees. This section depicts a more organized land usage with properties separated by clear demarcations, including fences and lines of trees or shrubbery. There is also a main paved road that connects these homes, discernible by its greyish color contrasting with the surrounding natural and developed elements.

The overall composition presents a fascinating juxtaposition of natural forestry and human habitation, reflecting a landscape shaped by both ecological elements and human activities. The image captures the interaction between natural landscape conservation and rural living, with human infrastructure integrated into the forested environment.
title: Aerial view of selected thinning of re-growth Douglas fir trees prior to development of the land.  This area and others like it will be affected by population growth when the navy's trident submarine base is built nearby.  A "new city" is proposed to house a substantial portion of the projected 27,000 people who will move into the area when the naval installation is built
